page.title: 06WATER MOVEMENT IN THE AREA.
page.content: The three reservoirs, Butterley, Blakeley and Wessenden Old all have earth dams and are filled by the rain water running off the surrounding hillsides and moors. The rain water makes its way via streams into the reservoirs and between them they store upto 2,272 thousand cubic metres(tcm) of water at any one time. Any water which cannot be stored in these reservoirs goes back into the stream and down into the River Colne. The water authority also has to compensate the water supply into the River by putting back 8.07tcm. per day from the water stored in the reservoirs. The water in these reservoirs is sent along pipes and catchments to Longwood treatment works. It is also pumped to Deer Hill and Blackmoorfoot Reservoirs to top up their supplies.
